text:
I used to run Apache 2.0.40 and was able to run two seaprate instances of httpd.
One instance was for the webserver on port 80 and the second instance was for a
webdav server on another port. Both used different directories for the document
web root. 

After upgrading both Apache instances to Apache 2.0.43, both instances of httpd
will no longer run concurrently. I can only run one instance but not the other.
I have tried the regular webserver and the webdav server and if one starts up
the other will not run. Even if I specify the compile time option of using a
specific port other than port 80, there is still a conflict between the two
instances of httpd.

The only workaround was to restore one of the httpd instances to Apache 2.0.40.
With one httpd instance at 2.0.43 and the other instance of httpd at 2.0.40,
both instances of httpd are able to run concurrently. However, I am not able to
run both at the latest version. I do not want to run a single instance of httpd
 as I want the flexibility to compartmentalize / modularize separate applications.
creator: rcaasi@ucsd.edu
trawick@apache.org
text:
what OS?
what "Listen" directives in the config files for the two instances?
what exact error messages?

I initially used the Listen directives:
Listen 80
for the first instance
and 
Listen 8181
for the second instance
These worked fine for Apache 2.0.40.
I tried to change the second to
Listen 172.16.1.2:8181
but this does not make any difference in Apache 2.0.43 or Apache 2.0.40.
I even tried compiling the port 8181 when configuring for the second instance
but it didn't have any effect at all.
